profile.name: MYKOLA CHUDAK
profile.education: {'designation': 'University of Manitoba, Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv', 'total_experience': '3.5, 3.6'}

summary.ai_summary: I am a skilled Data Engineer with a strong background in cloud and data engineering. I have experience in leading end-to-end D365 Finance & Operations implementations, developing PySpark transformation scripts, and designing functional design documents. I also have experience in data migration, project management, and machine learning.

experiences.job_description: Led 4 end-to-end D365 Finance & Operations implementation projects for mid-size enterprises, acting as technical lead for data migration and analytics streams, from initial data assessment through go-live and hypercare. Built and orchestrated ELT pipelines using Azure Data Factory, Databricks (PySpark), and Logic Apps to ingest and transform large-scale datasets from Azure Data Lake. Migrated the internal Data Migration toolkit from Azure Data Factory & Databricks to Microsoft Fabric & Dataverse, modernizing the stack and simplifying the architecture. Enabled near real-time data access by implementing Dataverse-based Fabric Lakehouses, replacing legacy batch processing with continuous data availability.

Developed PySpark transformation scripts and SQL logic to automate the extraction and cleansing of data for migration into D365 F&O. Integrated Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and Logic Apps to streamline ingestion, transformation, and loading processes.

Collaborated with functional teams to redesign 4+ D365 F&O modules, including project forecasting tools and wage compliance reportsâ€”two of which were deployed via PowerApps and improved reporting turnaround. Designed end-to-end training materials for Project Management and Cost Accounting modules, accelerating user onboarding and post-ERP transition. Drafted Functional Design Documents for custom features, ensuring alignment with user requirements and development feasibility. Facilitated ERP user acceptance testing across multiple modules, identifying and documenting 50+ functional gaps.

Completed multiple machine learning projects using Python (NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib), focusing on both supervised and unsupervised learning techniques. Developed end-to-end ML pipelines including preprocessing, model training (Linear/Logistic Regression, KNN, SVM), and deployment via RESTful APIs using MVC architecture. Participated in 3 Kaggle competitions and containerized ML applications using Docker, improving deployment scalability and reproducibility for future experiments.
